Class Component

  • java.lang.Object
    • Component
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ShipTurret

    public abstract class Component
extends java.lang.Object
    The component class is an abstraction layer which defines exactly what a component is. A component is a piece of "ship hardware" which gives a ship some sort of capability, either engines, shields, weapons etc. A module should be able to completely encapsulate a specific function of the ship.
    Author:
    Andrew

      abstract void update()
      This method declaration, given that this is an abstract class, requires each component inheriting from this class to implement an update method, which in principle will be unique to that type of component (called to determine how turrets fire weapons, how shields shield, how engines thrust etc).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Component

        public Component(Ship ship,
         java.lang.String ref)
        The constructor for this component. Takes in a ship this component is associated with, and the String ref, which is the image associated with the sprite representative of this component.
        Parameters:
        ship - The ship this component is associated with.
        ref - The String name of the image that represents the sprite

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g2D,
        double interp)
        This method is responsible for drawing the representative sprite of this component at an interpolated XY position. It takes the Graphics2D g2D object, which is used to draw the image to the graphics context. It also takes the double interpolation value, which is the value used to interpolate the actual or likely position this object should be rendered at to achieve a smooth graphics rendering.
        Parameters:
        g2D -
        interp -

      • getX

        public double getX()
        Returns the x coordinate on the viewable display of this component.
        Returns:
        the x

      • getY

        public double getY()
        Returns the y coordinate on the viewable display of this component.
        Returns:
        the y

      • setLastX

        public void setLastX(double lastX)
        Sets the value of the last X value of this component. This method is used by the hardpoint this component is attached to to make sure this is interpolated and drawn correctly.
        Parameters:
        lastX - The X position of this component on the previous cycle.

      • setLastY

        public void setLastY(double lastY)
        Sets the value of the last Y value of this component. This method is used by the hardpoint this component is attached to to make sure this is interpolated and drawn correctly.
        Parameters:
        lastY - The Y position of this component on the previous cycle.

      • setX

        public void setX(double x)
        This method is used by the hardpoint step() method in order to update the current position of this component at the hardpoint.
        Parameters:
        x - The current X position of this component this cycle.

      • setY

        public void setY(double y)
        This method is called by the hardpoint step() method in order to set this component.
        Parameters:
        y - The current Y position of this component at the hardpoint.

      • update

        public abstract void update()
        This method declaration, given that this is an abstract class, requires each component inheriting from this class to implement an update method, which in principle will be unique to that type of component (called to determine how turrets fire weapons, how shields shield, how engines thrust etc). This method is ultimately called by the entity itself, as each component is stored in a "component cache," which is iterated through to call the update() method of each unique component.
